pyTEMlib.file_tools¶

Functions

flatten_dict

get_h5_filename

get_last_path

get_main_channel

get_qt_app

will start QT Application if not running yet

get_start_channel

h5_tree

Just a wrapper for the sidpy function print_tree, so that sidpy does not have to be loaded in notebook

log_results

open_file

Opens a file if the extension is .hf5, .dm3 or .dm4 If no filename is provided the qt open_file windows opens

openfile_dialog

Opens a File dialog which is used in open_file() function This function uses tkinter or pyQt5.

read_old_h5group

make a sidpy dataset from pyUSID style hdf5 group input current_channel: h5_group return sidpy Dataset

save_path

savefile_dialog

Opens a save dialog in QT and returns an “*.hf5” file. New now with initial file.

set_dimensions

Attaches correct dimension from old pyTEMlib style.

set_directory
